00:00:03:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:03:060000.Dialogue: Seems like forever, since the four of us have been out to eat, you know? Just the guys.

00:00:08:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:08:000000.Dialogue: Oh, God! Yes, we get it. You have a girlfriend now.

00:00:18:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:18:030000.Dialogue: All right, I'd kill a hobo if it'll get me laid. Now, can we order?

00:00:22:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:22:040000.Dialogue: Oh, dear Lord, they re-did the menu.

00:00:25:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:25:190000.Dialogue: So what? It's the same food.

00:00:27:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:27:150000.Dialogue: Oh, is it? Look at this. General Tso's Chicken is no longer listed under "specialties." It's now under "chicken."

00:00:44:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:44:150000.Dialogue: So, why is it no longer a specialty?

00:00:48:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:48:070000.Dialogue: Did the chef lose confidence in the dish or himself? And look over here. "Shrimp in mobster sauce." What is "mobster sauce"?

00:01:01:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:01:120000.Dialogue: Perhaps. Or perhaps this restaurant's now a front for organized crime. For all we know, the mobster sauce contains actual chunks of deceased mobsters.

00:01:11:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:11:090000.Dialogue: No, no, no, no-- I think it just means it's the kind of sauce that mobsters like.

00:01:15:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:15:020000.Dialogue: It doesn't mean any of that! It's a typo.

00:01:18:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:18:150000.Dialogue: You know what? Let's just get a pizza.

00:01:19:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:19:200000.Dialogue: Good idea. We'll go to Corleone's.

00:01:27:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:27:070000.Dialogue: You know, the more I think about it, the mobster sauce couldn't possibly contain chunks of mobster.

00:01:40:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:40:180000.Dialogue: What if they were mobsters who slept with the fishes?

00:01:48:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:48:030000.Dialogue: Leonard, are we having a serious conversation or not?

00:02:03:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:03:120000.Dialogue: Oh, God. Oh, God. Oh, God! It's all right. They didn't take my comic books.

00:02:43:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:43:000000.Dialogue: They took our TV, two laptops, four external hard-drives, our PS2, our PS3, our X-Box, our X-Box 360, our classic Nintendo, our Super Nintendo, our Nintendo 64 and our Wii.

00:02:57:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:57:060000.Dialogue: Right, games. They took Halo 1, Halo 2, Halo 3, Call of Duty 1, Call of Duty 2, Call of Duty 3, Rock Band, Rock Band 2, Final Fantasy 1 thru 9, The Legend of Zelda, The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time, The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess, Super Mario Brothers, Super Mario Galaxy, Mario and Sonic at the Winter Olympics...

00:03:22:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:22:220000.Dialogue: When does the CSI team get here?

00:03:27:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:27:170000.Dialogue: In anticipation of their arrival, I've bagged some evidence. One of the thieves had the audacity to quench his thirst while ransacking our home. You should be able to pull some good prints off this. And now, here are my prints so you can rule me out as a suspect.

00:03:43:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:43:120000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, Leonard. It's too early to discount the possibility of this being an inside job.

00:03:48:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:48:040000.Dialogue: Would I be completely out of line to ask you to shoot him?

00:03:52:230000.Speaker: Policeman
00:03:52:230000.Dialogue: I'd be happy to put him under a 72-hour psychiatric hold.

00:03:57:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:57:080000.Dialogue: I'm not crazy. My mother had me tested.

00:04:01:020000.Speaker: Policeman
00:04:01:020000.Dialogue: We're done here. Call this number, and we'll fax you a copy of the report so you can submit it to your insurance company.

00:04:06:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:06:100000.Dialogue: I-I'm sorry. That's the end of your inquiry?

00:04:09:120000.Speaker: Policeman
00:04:09:120000.Dialogue: Do you have any more information that might be relevant?

00:04:13:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:13:150000.Dialogue: Oh, my goodness. Where do I begin? For instance-- my laptop contained four out of the five gedankenexperiments necessary for a cogent restatement of the quantum measurement problem.

00:04:22:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:22:030000.Dialogue: How is that going to help them?

00:04:24:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:24:030000.Dialogue: Well, they could monitor scientific publications and see if anyone posts such a cogent restatement in the next couple of months. If so, the authors are most likely in possession of my stolen laptop.

00:04:49:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:49:110000.Dialogue: What are we supposed to do now?

00:04:52:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:52:120000.Dialogue: The only thing we can do. Watch TV on our phones until the criminals return and bludgeon us to death in our sleep.

00:04:59:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:59:110000.Dialogue: Does that mean you've ruled me out as a suspect?

00:05:02:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:02:160000.Dialogue: Oh, how I wish I could.

00:05:56:100000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is restless. He gets up and checks the door is locked. He then moves his chest of drawers in front of the door. Goes back to bed.
00:05:56:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:56:100000.Dialogue: I do not have to urinate.

00:06:03:020000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is restless. He gets up and checks the door is locked. He then moves his chest of drawers in front of the door. Goes back to bed.
00:06:03:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:03:020000.Dialogue: I am the master of my own bladder.

00:06:08:010000.Scene: Sheldon’s bedroom. Sheldon is restless. He gets up and checks the door is locked. He then moves his chest of drawers in front of the door. Goes back to bed.
00:06:08:010000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:13:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:13:060000.Dialogue: I can't believe it. If I hadn't been working the dinner shift, I would've run right into the robbers.

00:06:18:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:18:170000.Dialogue: Hey, there's no reason for you to be scared.

00:06:21:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:21:020000.Dialogue: I'm not scared. I would've gone all Nebraska on their asses.

00:06:26:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:26:080000.Dialogue: (three knocks) SHELDON: Leonard and Penny. (three knocks) Leonard and Penny. (three knocks) Leonard and Penny.

00:06:35:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:35:090000.Dialogue: We just had a major crime in the building, and you open the door without asking who it is?

00:06:41:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:41:040000.Dialogue: It won't happen again. What's up?

00:06:42:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:42:190000.Dialogue: Nothing. I just wanted to see if you were both okay.

00:06:51:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:51:190000.Dialogue: Good night. That was weird, even for him.

00:06:58:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:58:120000.Dialogue: (three knocks) Leonard and Penny. (three knocks) Leonard and Penny. (three knocks) Leonard and Penny.

00:07:28:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:28:120000.Dialogue: Yes, we are. And we're about to go to bed.

00:07:34:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:34:090000.Dialogue: Sheldon, do you want to sleep here tonight?

00:07:36:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:36:100000.Dialogue: Oh, as small as Leonard is, I don't think the two of you'd be comfortable on the couch.

00:07:44:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:44:190000.Dialogue: It's not what I want, it's what evolution wants. Human beings are primates. Primates have evolved to live in groups, both for protection and support.

00:07:53:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:53:060000.Dialogue: But you don't like other people.

00:07:56:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:56:230000.Dialogue: I do tonight. It's scary over there.

00:08:12:080000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:08:12:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:12:080000.Dialogue: Um... three little kittens? Three little pigs? God, I don't know. Star Wars?

00:08:28:120000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:08:28:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:28:120000.Dialogue: Did we win? Can we go to bed?

00:08:30:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:08:30:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:30:210000.Dialogue: Good Lord-- I could not have made this easier. Hydrogen atom, H, plus pigs minus pea-- Higgs. Bow, General Zod trapped in the Phantom Zone.

00:08:43:230000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:08:43:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:43:230000.Dialogue: Bow-zone. Pear. Tickle. Pear-tickle. Higgs Boson Particle.

00:08:54:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:08:54:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:54:010000.Dialogue: How could you not get that?

00:08:56:010000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:08:56:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:56:010000.Dialogue: He's right, Penny. It's all there.

00:09:00:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:00:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:00:170000.Dialogue: Sheldon, sweetie, I know you're feeling insecure, but we've really got to go to sleep.

00:09:05:040000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:05:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:05:040000.Dialogue: All right. I'll take the first watch and wake you at 0400.

00:09:09:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:09:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:10:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:10:210000.Speaker: Penny

00:09:12:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:12:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:09:14:190000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:14:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:35:140000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:35:140000.Speaker: Woman on TV
00:09:35:140000.Dialogue: WOMAN (on TV): It's quiet out there.

00:09:37:020000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:37:020000.Speaker: Man
00:09:37:020000.Dialogue: MAN (on TV): Maybe a little too quiet.

00:09:39:060000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:39:060000.Speaker: Woman on TV

00:09:40:140000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:40:140000.Speaker: Man on TV
00:09:40:140000.Dialogue: Just gonna take a look around outside.

00:09:42:100000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:42:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:46:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:46:180000.Speaker: Woman on TV
00:09:46:180000.Dialogue: No, Jim, don't open the door!

00:09:48:140000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:48:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:09:53:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:09:53:180000.Speaker: Man on TV
00:09:53:180000.Dialogue: Don't worry. There's no one out there. (door slamming)

00:10:05:190000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:10:05:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:05:190000.Dialogue: (three knocks) SHELDON: Leonard and Penny! (three knocks) Leonard and Penny! (three knocks) Leonard and Penny!

00:10:11:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is drawing picture clues on his whiteboard.
00:10:11:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:18:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:18:100000.Dialogue: All right, we've got a titanium dead bolt and a reinforced jamb controlled by a state-of-the-art electronic access system.

00:10:25:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:25:060000.Dialogue: What if they cut the power?

00:10:26:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:26:120000.Dialogue: There's a 200-watt uninterruptible backup power supply.

00:10:29:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:29:120000.Dialogue: What if someone steals my keys?

00:10:34:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:34:010000.Dialogue: What if someone kidnaps me, forces me to record my voice, and then cuts off my thumb?

00:10:38:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:38:180000.Dialogue: I'll send them a basket of muffins.

00:10:43:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:43:030000.Dialogue: Now, inside, we've got motion detectors, infrared sensors, and cameras connected to a server running state-of-the-art facial recognition software.

00:10:53:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:53:150000.Dialogue: Where did you get all this stuff?

00:10:55:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:55:120000.Dialogue: Eh, I got a buddy over at the Department of Defense.

00:10:58:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:58:080000.Dialogue: He just gave it to you?

00:10:59:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:59:170000.Dialogue: I'm sure he would have if I had asked.

00:11:06:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:06:090000.Dialogue: Raj, your car is blocking me... (alarm blaring) COMPUTER VOICE: Intruder alert, intruder alert. (screams) Intruder alert. What the hell?

00:11:12:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:12:140000.Dialogue: Intruder alert. Sorry, let me help you.

00:11:15:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:15:020000.Dialogue: Wonderful security system if we're attacked by a school of tuna.

00:11:19:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:19:160000.Dialogue: Don't worry, the net's going to be electrified. You picture her on the floor, spasming uncontrollably.

00:11:30:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:30:230000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Sheldon's journal. Security system in place. However, sleep continues to elude me. I've seen the underbelly of Pasadena...

00:11:42:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:42:070000.Dialogue: this so-called City of Roses, and it haunts me. Ah, the injustice. I lie here awake, tormented, while out there evil lurks, probably playing Donkey Kong on my classic Nintendo.

00:12:35:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:35:170000.Dialogue: I am the master of my own bladder.

00:12:54:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:54:090000.Dialogue: (three knocks) Leonard and Penny. (three knocks) Leonard and Penny. (three knocks) Leonard and Penny.

00:13:04:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:04:200000.Dialogue: What the hell are you doing out there?

00:13:13:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:13:210000.Dialogue: It was us. We knocked over a lamp.

00:13:16:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:16:220000.Dialogue: Why would you knock over a lamp?

00:13:18:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:18:210000.Dialogue: He doesn't need to know what we were doing, Leonard.

00:13:27:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:27:070000.Dialogue: No, she's right, I don't need to know what you were doing. Carry on.

00:13:31:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:31:190000.Dialogue: What are you doing? Use the door.

00:13:37:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:37:200000.Dialogue: Perhaps I'll check the perimeter and make some warm milk.

00:13:43:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:43:180000.Dialogue: Would you like me to bring you some warm milk?

00:13:48:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:48:190000.Dialogue: And you don't wish to alarm me with any more loud noises. Very thoughtful.

00:13:56:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:56:180000.Dialogue: Fine. Good night to you, sir. Miss.

00:14:05:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:05:060000.Dialogue: Ugh, what can you do? Here. Intruder alert, intruder alert. (alarm blaring) Intruder alert, intruder alert. (electricity arcing, Sheldon screaming)

00:14:25:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:25:040000.Dialogue: Looks like Wolowitz got the net electrified.

00:14:30:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:30:090000.Dialogue: I-I'm fine... although I'm no longer the master of my own bladder.

00:14:39:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:39:160000.Dialogue: My new computer came with Windows 7.

00:14:44:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:44:190000.Dialogue: Windows 7 is much more user- friendly than Windows Vista.

00:14:54:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:54:100000.Dialogue: Don't you think looking for a new city to live in is a bit of an overreaction?

00:14:59:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:59:050000.Dialogue: Our apartment was broken into, our security system tried to kill me, and as a result, I'm leaving Pasadena forever. Tell me how that's overreacting.

00:15:08:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:08:110000.Dialogue: Come on, Sheldon, you can't move. Don't you need to stay in one place so the mother ship can find you when it returns? (laughing)

00:15:16:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:16:110000.Dialogue: Oh, if that were only true. Unfortunately, as I'm earthbound for the foreseeable future, I need to find a location that's more hospitable than the mean streets of Pasadena, like... Enid, Oklahoma. Low crime rate and high-speed Internet connectivity... but no model train shops.

00:15:43:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:43:220000.Dialogue: Is he quitting his job at the university?

00:15:46:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:46:060000.Dialogue: Oh, no, he's going to telecommute. Everybody's really excited about it.

00:15:51:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:51:020000.Dialogue: All right. Boone, North Carolina. "Every summer since 1952, "Boone has hosted an outdoor amphitheater portrayal of the life and times of its namesake, Dan'l Boone." Sounds like something that would attract the wrong crowd.

00:16:20:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:20:220000.Dialogue: It will take me a few days to get settled. After I do, I will e-mail you detailed PDFs containing diagrams and instructions that will guide you through packing and shipping the rest of my possessions to Bozeman, Montana.

00:16:34:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:34:120000.Dialogue: In the meantime, please forward my mail.

00:16:37:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:37:090000.Dialogue: Any place specific or just the Bozeman, Montana Loony Bin?

00:16:42:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:42:140000.Dialogue: I sense you're making a joke, but Bozeman does have a comedy club called The Loony Bin, so do not forward my mail there.

00:16:49:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:49:210000.Dialogue: Oh, come on. So you were the victim of a crime. That's part of life. When my great-grandfather first came to this country, he put all his hopes and dreams into this little butcher shop he ran on the Lower East Side of New York. You know what happened? Every customer who walked into that butcher shop and asked for a pound of liver, (fingers snap) got ripped off.

00:17:12:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:12:220000.Dialogue: But... those people moved on, and so should you.

00:17:17:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:17:210000.Dialogue: I am moving on. I'm going to be a Bozite.

00:17:23:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:23:180000.Dialogue: They should. It's one of the first things I plan to bring up upon arrival.

00:17:28:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:28:120000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I can't believe I'm saying this, but I'm going to miss you.

00:17:30:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:30:180000.Dialogue: Please, Penny, as you know, I'm not comfortable with prolonged good-byes and maudlin displays of emotion, so I prepared a short video.

00:17:43:060000.Speaker: Sheldon on laptop screen
00:17:43:060000.Dialogue: SHELDON (on laptop): Greetings. As you know, I'm not comfortable with prolonged good-byes and maudlin displays of emotion, so I prepared this short video. The four of you are three of my closest friends and one treasured acquaintance.

00:18:02:220000.Speaker: Sheldon on laptop screen
00:18:02:220000.Dialogue: Though I cannot state categorically that my life will be diminished by not having you in it, I am comfortable if you choose to believe that.

00:18:12:080000.Speaker: Sheldon on laptop screen
00:18:12:080000.Dialogue: Since you intend to remain in this lawless metropolitan area, statistics suggest that you will succumb to tragic and gruesome ends before we meet again. Live long and prosper.

00:18:30:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:30:120000.Dialogue: You might want to lock the door behind me.

00:18:39:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:39:110000.Dialogue: How the hell do I know who's the friend and who's the acquaintance?

00:18:48:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:48:190000.Dialogue: That is a bracing cold, an invigorating cold. Lord, is it cold!

00:18:56:130000.Speaker: Man
00:18:56:130000.Dialogue: Help you with your bags, sir?

00:18:58:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:58:200000.Dialogue: Thank you, fellow Bozite. And may I say, you are the living embodiment of all the promises made by our lovely town's Chamber of Commerce.

00:19:29:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:29:050000.Dialogue: One ticket to Pasadena, California, please.

00:19:42:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:42:230000.Dialogue: Interesting. The acquaintance is the first to greet me.
